review: Came here about a week ago to have lunch with some girlfriends. I was actually really surprised that the place was not busy at all for lunchtime on a Saturday, especially since this is a mall location. A couple of us ordered salads and a couple of us ordered tacos. I thought my salad was just fine, the server got my requests right (no bleu cheese, dressing on the side) and he was prompt with drink refills. I just thought the food wasn't that good. The ladies that ordered tacos liked them a lot. I don't make it a habit to come to any CPK location and this experience did nothing to help or hurt that opinion.

This visit was a to-go visit, and it was pretty good. The order took about 20 minutes to be ready which consisted of a medium BBQ pizza, a full order of the chopped salad and a half order of the roasted vege salad. First off my vege salad was really good, it has corn, artichoke hearts, eggplant, red  and yellow peppers on a green salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing...I could do without the artichoke hearts. The salad was quite big for a half, more then enough. My friends got a med BBQ pizza and shared a full order of the chopped salad. For a medium pizza, its pretty small and a little expensive for the size. The chopped salad was good, I was told, and it was quite big.

Great place the wait was long since its located in a busy malle but other than that it's business as usual. The service was good and always came with a smile. The food is consistantly good but my fave is just a traditional pizza.

The restaurant is located in between Nordstrom and Macy's. The place is smaller than other CPK restaurants. The inside is pretty nice and colorful.  What I ordered was the following: 1. Spaghetti bolognese-This was salty and bland. The meat and the tomatoes tasted very fresh though.  2. Bread with butter-Better than the CPK in Brea...The bread was soft, but the butter was a bit hardened still.  3. White corn guacamole with chips-The guacamole was my favorite, very refreshing and good! The chips were stale...that was the down side... Service here was ok. I guess because it was weird when one of the chefs brought me a dish and I could not understand him at all...I would think that the servers would be doing that...I'm confused about their duties for their titles. The check took forever...so the manager took the tab instead of my own server. (My server only had three tables...they were couples and myself...) Overall, I think that I won't be coming back to this CPK.

I've visited many CPK's throughout California and Hawaii and since it's a franchise type of restaurant, I wasn't thinking of reviewing it.  However, due to the great service we received at the Santa Ana location, I decided to do a quick review.      We arrived about 20 minutes to closing and we were in a bit of a bind because we just came out of Disneyland and the kids (and us) were hungry.  We were tired of theme park food and wanted to get pizza and salad.  We were afraid that we would be told that the restaurant would be closing soon and that only part of the menu would be available.  Quite the opposite!  We were given top level service.  Our waitress was very good and was always around when we needed something.      As for the food, we had the Thai chicken pizza and the Chicken Caesar salad.  The kids had pepperoni and cheese.   The food was good, the service was excellent and we were very satisfied with our experience there.  Best of all, the restrooms were very clean!   4 stars for the food and service, plus 1 extra star for the cleanliness of the restrooms.  Good job CPK Santa Ana!

This has been my second time here but I do not recall my first so I guess this can be my first!  Right when we walked in, the door was opened by the hostess. Right then, I knew this was a great place for lunch.  We sat down and started to order.  Our waitress, Alina, was such a sweetheart!  She was very helpful in recommending what to eat! Our pizzas did take awhile to come out but thats okay. we were filling up on the artichoke dip, which was DELICIOUS by the way!!  As for the pizzas we ordered: Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Spicy chipotle sauce, chicken, mild chilies, Mozzarella and Enchilado cheese. Topped with roasted corn & black bean salsa, cilantro and lime cream sauce. This was awesome!!  Loved the spicy kick to it and I am one to not eat spicy.  Loved the thickness of the pizza too Pesto Chicken Thin Crust: Pesto chicken, onions, Mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes, basil pesto sauce and toasted pine nuts.  We requested to have half the pine nuts on one side of the pizza.  Alina was not sure if they could do that but she asked and she delivered!  Thanks!! Overall, I think everyone should have customer service like this!  The food was delicious, bathrooms were clean, and our waitress was there to refill the drinks when needed!  Thanks for a great lunch!:) NOTE: -clean bathrooms -great service

I'd like to give this restaurant a higher rating, but unfortunately my latest experience didn't merit it.  My friend and i went on a bit of a chilly evening. We were concerned about having to sit out on the patio since they were pretty busy that night. The manager assured us that it would be comfortable since there are heat lamps placed out there. We sat directly beneath the lamp, and proved right.  A few minutes later, our server appears, and he just looks and acts like he really doesn't want to be there at all. He didn't introduce himself at all, and the only reason we knew what his name was, was because of the fact that the manager had stated "so n so will be here shortly".  Luckily, the food was really delicious, and the manager was a complete doll. Maybe he could pass along the good manners to this particular staff member.

One of the better lunch spots in the area, is pretty much consistent with other CPKs.  Feeling adventurous, I decided to give their new small bites menu a try.  Korean Bbq Tacos: Not bad. These had more of szechuan flavor than a bulgogi flavor. I would have preferred they put kimchi in it, but really what am I expecting from an americanized place. They were pretty saucy.  Macaroni and Cheese: The were in nugget form. I wasn't expecting them to do that. Instead of a bowl of mac and cheese they came out with four deep fried mac and cheese nuggets. I felt like I should have a side of ketchup or ranch with them, they were so awkward. Never again.  Avocado Egg Rolls - Sooo good. Might be the avocado bias, but I really enjoyed these.  Service was fast and friendly. The wait is also not so bad for lunch area. If it's crowded, remember you can seat yourself at the bar!

I was very hungry and decided to order take out from this place which was a BIG mistake to say the least. I called CPK (which apparently is a call center) and they asked if they could put me on hold so I said OK. Someone else then picked up the phone and told me the exact same thing, I said OK again. Finally the original girl gets back on the phone and begins to take my order. I mentioned something as I was ordering and obviously she was per-occupied because she replied with something that had nothing to do with what I asked. Anyways my order was finished and I was on my way to pickup my curbside order. I show up to CPK and it so happened someone was just picking up their order so it was perfect I did not have to call for the server to come out. She asked my name which I gave along with my credit card to pay. She comes back outside and says they have no record of my order in their system and she accidentally charged my card ($65) for someone else's order! (Mind you my order would have been bout $13) By this time I'm extremely agitated, turn off my car take out my two year old daughter and walk inside to ask for the manager, Anthony who looked like he was expecting me and seemed annoyed. He said the money had been refunded and if I'd like to place an order he would gladly do so. I told Anthony I wanted him to call my card company to have the funds released, he sighed and rudely told me he needed my card again so he could call the card company. About 15 minutes go by and the manager Anthony comes back and says "like I told you before your card had the money put back towards it". The manager, Anthony still makes no effort to offer any shape or form of compensation which made matters worse. Being the responsible adult I am, I turned around and kindly walked out the door. I will never go back to this CPK, I will gladly drive the extra 5 minutes to eat at the one in Irvine or Tustin. I can't believe they would higher managers such as Anthony given the excellent reputation of this restaurant chain.

What we usually get: - jambalaya pasta - snack size quesadilla - bbq chicken pizza - chipotle chicken pizza I'm in love with the jambalaya here. I always get it because I have a hard time trying something new. Sometimes I want a pizza so I'm caught in a dilemma but luckily I go with the bf most of the time and he always orders a pizza so I get the best of both worlds. Yay! Bbq chicken pizza is our favorite pizza here. It never disappoints and the flavor is still brought out even though I drown it with red pepper flakes! Chipotle pizza is our second favorite! We have a hard time deciding between the two sometimes! The snack size quesadillas are impressive. They pack a lot of flavor! Wish they weren't so small! Service varies. Can be slow sometimes... Service was once so slow that they comped a few of our dishes and gave us some percentage off.

I went to lunch at this CPK today for my co-worker's birthday celebration. There were 11 of us, and we made a reservation ahead of time. We ended up moving two tables together and had a nice spot near the window, where we saw the weather improve slightly throughout our meal. Our server was nice - although one of my co-workers who sat next to me was slightly irked that he gave her no lemon in her water when she asked for some and then gave her a to-go box when she didn't want one. The young restaurant manager also came around to greet us near the end. That was nice; I think many restaurants are implementing that practice now to improve customer service. I ended up ordering the asparagus and spinach spaghettini with shrimp ($15). It looked delicious. Taste-wise, the shrimps and veggies were yummy but the spaghettini itself tasted a little bland. Maybe it was because I asked for no Parmesan? The portion was a little small for the price - I gobbled it all up in no time! I love asparagus and spinach, and I wished there was more of both. Overall, I think the food here is not bad but a little expensive.

I went here yesterday to grab a quick lunch while waiting to pick something up from the mall.  We ordered the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza ($13) and two items from the small cravings menu - The Wedge Salad ($5) and the Quesadilla ($5) The BBQ Chicken Pizza was really disappointing...maybe I'm spoiled by Stonefire's pizzas but this lacked flavor. I would not recommend it and would not order it again. The Wedge Salad was DRENCHED in dressing...I guess I should've ordered the dressing on the side. I was disappointed and the flavor of the dressing was kind of bleh. The Quesadilla was the best thing we ordered, it was just decent.  The service was ok, our waiter ignored us a little bit but he looked miserable so I'll cut him some slack.  What grossed me out was that we were constantly swatting away these nats while we were eating! I was scared to open my mouth, it was disgusting. CLEAN YOUR TABLES!!!! I will not be back.

This CPK at Main Place Mall is kind of small but you can access it from outside, you don't have to go in the mall.  We were a party of four and had two coupons for free spinach dip.  Our waitor was so nice and let us use both coupons if we split the check.  I don't remember his name but he was awesome!  I split the Thai chicken pizza and BBQ chicken salad with my friend.  Everything was good except the salad had barely any chicken or bbq sauce.  We asked for refills on our drinks to go and the waitor was happy to do it.  And the spinach dip was super good!

Until last weekend, the only time ive ever eaten CPK was at the airport. I remember it being ok but i never went back. Well last weekend I was out  of town in LA for a few days attending my wife's nephew's graduation and we all ended up coming here. It was very good. I got the all meat pizza and split it with someone that got the chicken caesar sandwich. My wife got the thin crust white sauce, chicken pizza. It was all very good. Although I didnt try everyone else's food, they ordered a variety of things.  Pasta, sandwiches, salads, pizza .. I didnt see anything that didnt look hella good. The only things i didnt like about the restaurant was that the ranch was NOT great, and the pizzas only come in personal size so if you come with a few people it could get more expensive than the average pizza place. Overall I liked it and look forward to going back and trying some other things.
Many Fridays I have lunch here with a co-worker from LA.  We almost always sit at the same table outside and the waitstaff who have been there a while take very good care of us.
I really like CPK. I know it's a chain but the pizza is so good. I really like the Jambalaya too! More expensive but the food is really good.

My husband and I went to CPK on Sunday and Monday for Veterans Day and Brennan was amazing and the Manager was very friendly. We loved the food and drinks! Very reasonable prices and the Mango Lemonade was Ridiculously amazing! Thanks to all the friendly staff for a great experience.

Service is very spotty. Several of the waiters are pretty surly - poorly trained in customer service. On many occasions they will run out of bread. They used to substitute pita bread when that happened. Tonight my waiter said I could order pita bread for $1.00. I can afford the buck but let me get this right. You didn't order enough bread, had a busy day and ran out so the best substitute is now a charge? The manager dropped by and asked how things were. I brought it up and he said yes, "the company changed the policy and no more pita bread as a substitute." Put that together with an attitude-bearing 20-something waiter who makes you practically beg for a refill of Arnold Palmer and I'm rethinking why I come here 2-3 times a week. Its not like they're giving away food at bargain basement prices! I think I'll search for another favorite dinner place to drop into on the way home from work.

4 for food, 3 for service.  I've been to CPK many times & thought this location was OK. It is small compared to the other ones I've been to.  We received prompt service as soon as we arrived. It was after 8PM so may explain why. Food was brought quickly too, but then again restaurant wasn't crowded at all.  We ordered:  BBQ chopped chicken salads  Thai crunch salad  Dumpling appetizer  Fried Mac & cheese Roasted artichoke & spinach pizza  The salads were bomb, as always. The pizza is awesome too, I recommend it! Garlicky & cheesy.  Fried Mac & cheese looked better than it actually tasted. You aren't missing out. Same with the dumplings. Let an actual Chinese restaurant make those for you.  Also awkward moment was when our waiter told us they were out of bread for table. Bummmmeeerrr.  Our waiter was ok. She had a bit of an attitude & you could tell she wanted to be off work. I don't blame her for being tired but I really wanted to tell her to get rid of the bitch face while taking our orders.  Good food as usual & expected but I enjoy the service at my local CPK better...JUST SAYING.

Located outside next to Nordstrom at the Main Place mall. It was mid afternoon on a Saturday and I was ravishing hungry. We were seated asap and I went with the strawberry lemonade which is my favorite beverage here. I placed an order for a wild mushroom pizza and the roasted veggie salad. The  yummy salad arrived first and CPK was generous with roasted artichoke,  asparagus, eggplant, zucchini, scallions, roasted Corn, avocado and sun dried tomatoes. The pizza arrived next and I could really taste the wild mushrooms cheese and was so delish. Last item was  jambalaya fettuccine which was loaded with shrimp, craw fish, sausage, blackened chicken and ham. The Jambalaya had a nice kick of spiciness and was perfect to split for several people. Our young waiter was attentive and took good care of us the entire meal. He kept refilling my strawberry lemonade automatically without request. I'm usually not a chain restaurant fan but CPK seems to consistently perform on the food quality and service. Definitely will be returning at a CPK somewhere in So Cal.

Had the WORST experience here. The waitress or whatever she was "Robin" was so rude and kept rushing us. She also gave a lot of attitude throughout and more so when we were ready to leave and asked for paper plates (we ordered take out). She said "it did not say utensils on your receipt so I didn't know they were necessary but here" and handed them with sass. I will never order from here again. Oh we also waited 30min to get our food which left us with only 30min remaining of our lunch. No thanks.

I used to love to eat at CPK. OMG-the barbeque chicken pizza? My husband and I ate there right after we got married.  I still have their first cookbook and their pizza dough recipe is my standard. Fresh food, innovative, seasonal menu, cool atmosphere. That was before the conglomorization... So Mikey and I were doing some CHRISTmas shopping at the mall and he begged to eat here as he loves their frozen pizza-how could I say no? My son is not a foodie yet. He is 11 and loves food. He really will try anything from duck to sushi to tripe but if he had his druthers we would eat at Islands, TGIF, Olive Garden-places I won't eat at. I still have a lot of work to do. That being said, we had lunch here. Arrived at 11 am. Ordered apps, salads and two pizzas. Our server had one other table and we waited for 20 minuted and the app never showed but out came the salads.  The table that was seated next to us arrived after us, and received apps, salads and pizza before we did and we didn't order anything special or off menu The pizzas arrived  and never a remark of the afore mentioned missing order. The food-salads and pizza were nothing special-exactly what you would expect from a cookie cutter franchise. The service though, that was what I tried to explain to Mikey. You can eat shit on a shingle but if the service is good and it is presented  with care, you will feel like you had a five star dining experience... Obviously didn't experience that here...

Its your typical CPK. Nothing fancy, just good comfort Italian/ Californian food... pasta, salad, soup, and pizza.  The service can be spotty, and you have to ask for bread (its posted in tiny print on the menu).  They serve pepsi (sorry coke fans) and the food is better if you share with friends. Parking can be a pain, since its in a mall.

This place has really gone down over the past few years. When CPK was just catching on they always had fantastic service and great food, but now I notice that my food is overly salty and the service just seems bored and doesn't want to be there. Maybe it's because the mall in general feels like it's losing its spark, but if you can make it to another CPK in the area, I would suggest it.

It's is not my first time going to CPK however my first time here at this location by the Main Place Mall. I felt the need to post a review because for the first time I walked out of that restaurant feeling like I just got robbed. Where do I begin?  Okay, food..was alright I mean nothing spectacular. I wasn't expecting exotic flavors or what not. I ordered Garlic Cream Fetuccini with shrimp..first of all it felt like the serving got smaller and then my food came out with Chicken instead of shrimp. I did not return or complain about it because after let's say 25 minutes of waiting for my food, I was just about ready to eat anything (like the leftover from the table next to me!?!? I know eeew!) Then service...this was the most disappointing part for me. I liked our server when she first came up..seemed friendly, warm and welcoming..Then after she brought our water it got spotty.. She didn't bother checking up on us while we're waiting for our food. She didn't follow up on our order knowing that it was already taking a while, she did not check up on us after we got out order, once maybe when she was literally passing by..I finally asked for the bill, she brought out to-go bag without the bill. Said she was going to come back with the bill but never did. I finally asked the Manager, since I was so annoyed and couldn't wait to wake up from that nightmare. At the end of it all, the Manager apologized for all the delays and the long wait and gave me a coupon for a free meal and a drink for my next visit. I appreciate it but if I were to go back and use that coupon, it's probably not going to be at this location.

The food here is definitely not worth the price. Maybe it's the location or the slow service. It doesn't really matter because the only thing my best friend and I enjoyed was the barbeque chicken pizza. The artichoke dip was mediocre. And I, being a total food lover, would not say that unless it were true. I have had much better artichoke dip at other restaurants and this one was just plain bad. The chocolate souffle' was meh. It was our first time here at this location and our last.

Ok, these were good restaurants when they were novel - 15 years ago. But the food is bland and uninspiring. We live in OC where there are hundreds of great hole in the wall restaurants - most with an awesome ethnic flare. Go to Little Saigon and have some great Viet food instead. It's only 10 minutes from CPK!

Went here today with my mom, 2 sisters, and my daughter and nephew. The wait time to be seated was about 8 minutes; not bad for a party of 6 considering it being a Sunday afternoon and St. Patricks day.  The reason i am giving them 3 stars is because we waited about 1hr for our food! The server came about 30min into our wait saying he would be back with our food. Then about 20min later he comes back and apologizes for the wait. Letting us know that one of our orders was done wrong so they had to do it again.  He made up by bringing bread and making sure we got refills on our drinks. Finally the food came and it was as good as always. I usually order the Chicken Tequila Fettucini. It is delicious i would recommend it to anyone!!! All the other plates were great as well.  So overall they deserve 3 stars. Because of how long the food took because of their mistake and also because the service was just okay. I will still be coming back it wasnt that bad, just not WOWwwed ((:

Wait time was 15 mins to get a table even though we were looking at open tables, during lunch hour. We were finally seated in a section where no waitress was assigned. Service was painfully slow. The little girl next to us found a shrimp in her macaroni, thank god she doesn't have a shell fish allergy. I love cpk but this one is off my visit list :-(

Less than average CPK. I am a self proclaimed CPK expert. I have gone to almost every location and have tasted ever thing on the CPK menu. I know CPK. and this location is, well, below my CPK standards. The music at this location is always played too loud. Conversation hampering loud. The women's bathroom is a little on the dated side. And the entire restaurant is carpeted. With dirty carpet. Who has carpet in their restaurant anymore?  This evening I was craving me some CPK and since this was the closest location I went, even though I knew better. Once again the music was too loud. The "fresh" lemonade was disgusting! (And I swear was from a powdered mix) and my BLT pizza was a remarkable deviation from all of the millions of other BLT pizzas I have ordered over the years at all of the other CPKs I have been to. The lettuce was wilty, and did not have enough dressing/mayo on it. The crust was tougher than it typically is, and the tomatoes were diced in very large chunks (too large) and not sliced thinly for each pizza slice.  I love CPK, but hate this location.

This evening my friends and I were seated outside and then immediately forgotten. Although there was one other table right next to us getting served, we did not even receive glasses of water. Thirty minutes after waiting for a server we decided to leave and head over to Olive Garden. Needless to say, we were not forgotten at Olive Garden. I am not enthusiastic about returning to this location.

I had a disappointing dinner here last week. Was craving unique pizza so I ordered their California Club Pizza which is composed of chicken, bacon, mozzarella, and topped with avocado and lettuce tossed in mayo. It sounds great but the pizza was bland. There was no synergy between all of the ingredients. I remember eating this when it first came out years ago and it was great but what happened? A waste of $13. But my friends enjoyed their pizzas: Spicy Chipotle and Original BBQ Chicken. Our waiter was awesome so no complaints with service.

After my spaghetti ordeal, I will never stray from the chicken tequila pasta or thai salad again. The pasta and salad has never disappointed. They're good, nothing more to add than that. Now the spaghetti, I ordered it to go. I  chose tomato basil sauce and added chicken for an additional charge. They barely gave me any sauce when I had so much pasta. 2 tbsp maybe...Spaghetti is not spaghetti unless you have tomato sauce all over your mouth when you're done. I was eating dry noodles.

Busy spot in main place mall. Excellent salads and service. Exotic pizza is the specialty here but many other healthy selections. Not a place I would choose as I don't eat cheese but my friends all love this place. Overall good experience especially for a chain restaurant

Quite possibly the worst service I've had. If you're hungry, you're better off going anywhere else but here...unless you want your servers to completely ignore you and wait just to get water and bread. Waited and stared at each other for 10 minutes, until our server finally came back and we had to remind her to bring us our water. Ordered an iced tea and I kid you not, it was warm because my server failed to put enough ice. You'd think it be a no brainer to put ice in iced tea. This CPK is completely run down...the tables needed a serious cleaning. It's too bad, CPK typically has good food...just avoid this location.

Average CPK... Music was WAY to loud.. We were seated immediately bc there was no wait however we waited an hour for 2 pizzas... Our waitress never offered us bread.. I had to ask another waitress passing by for some once we had been waiting for 30 min... Horrible service! I would not come back here!!!

HORRIBLE SERVICE! AVOID THIS LOCATION AT ALL COST!! This place is horrible. The hostess gave me and my coworkers the dirtiest look when we walked in. Literally her eyes were wide open and her facial expression made her look like she was tired of us standing there and wanted us to move. Everyone noticed it, so please learn to control your facial expressions. You looked like you were surprised more people walked in to the restaurant to eat.  My coworkers and I all knew what we wanted, but we have to wait 5 minutes for our server to come over and acknowledge us. Normally I wouldn't be bothered, but other people who arrived after us had already gotten their drinks. Waitress comes by and takes our drink orders and says she'll be back to take our orders. Another 10 minutes pass, we got our order in and asked for bread. At this point in time, other customers have come in and she decides to give them their bread and drinks before ours (we only ordered water btw).  At this point it's been more than half a hour since we  sat down and we're all more than a little upset. Had to ask where our food was because people who sat down 10 minutes after got their food and we notice that their servers are actually paying attention to them! Once she brings out the food, we ask for the check so we can just pay and leave,  but she says OK and disappears into the back to emerge another 10 minutes later.  By the time we left, we all agreed this was probably one of the WORST dining experiences we've had. This is not the first time either at this location. I seriously don't ever want to dine at this location ever again. It makes me think all the workers there are incompetent. If you can't even handle the restaurant on a slow day how the hell can you manage things when it's lunch and dinner hours?
The white pizza and five cheese with tomato pizzas were great!  Great tasting grub but the service was horrible from the waitress.  This is one of the better tasting cpk's around my side of town.

First time I had this place was last year at this exact location...and I'm definitely hooked. The pizza just tastes so good it's ridiculous. Price per pizza was kind of WTF for me at first, but now I don't even care...just give me my pizza please :) If you're a pizza craver - this is the spot. Definitely want to try other items on the menu for sure.
They don't offer gluten free so I called to ask if they'd make my pasta if they brought it in and they very rudely refused.

We went for lunch and I got the BBQ chopped chicken salad. The lettuce looked and taste terrible. My wife got the flat bread pizza and it came out burnt. Don't get the mac n cheese it was horrible. The service was good. That's why I gave 2 stars. I won't be back
The pizzas are over priced and not a huge variety to choose from the customer service is good but we left and went to Olive Garden
Came here on valentine's day and love it, the pizza was really good even do seemed it took forever, the server was very polite and prices were good

This past weekend was my first time @ this location. I was a little nervous about visiting this CPK per the previous Yelp reviews. My date & I came here after the mall closed, so you need to park topside. We decided to sit outside with heat lamps due to the noise level inside.  CPK was running a Valentine's Day prefixed menu - 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, & dessert for $30. This wasn't my first time @ a CPK so I knew what I wanted. Here's what we chose -  Appetizer -  °Artichoke Dip: it was ordinary, nothing special but not horrible Entrees - °Original BBQ Chicken: can't go wrong with a classic °Fettuccini w/ Chicken: creamy & delicious Dessert - °Butter Cake w/ vanilla ice cream: not too bad, good one to end the meal Service on Sat night was exceptional. The hostess open the open for us, kindly asked us for seating inside or outside. My date was not fond of the suggested drink special - Lovetini. She said it was too sweet and the waiter had no problem substituting for another drink. No complaints and will be back @ this location.

My mom & I came here after a long day at work. We ordered the chicken tortilla soup, avocado eggrolls, & chicken tequila pasta. The appetizers came out in a timely manner. My mom seemed to like the soup. The eggrolls were a bit too greasy (probably from frying them). The pasta took a long time to come out, I was starting to get into a worse mood, I was just hungry. I know the appetizers come out first but the pasta took a very long time to arrive. It wasnt busy either. It finally arrived, our waitress Angie? apologized. The pasta was yummy, one of the usuals I order. Our water was always refilled, which is great customer service, means they pay attention to detail & actual take care of you. We then ordered tiramisu. It was good, had a big rum flavor, which I like. When we got the bill, the manager ended up comping off our tiramisu for the inconvenience of the delay of the pasta. Awesome! Thank you for that! Would I come back? Yes. Thanks to the manager & Angie.
The server, Michelle, was AWESOME!!!!  My tea was kept full from arrival, throughout the meal and then given a to-go cup upon departure.

I love CPK, but the service today during lunch was the worst I have ever experienced.  I have two small children and it took 2 1/2 hours from the time we were seated for lunch to the time that we paid the bill.  We came in before the lunch rush and left after everyone was done and had gone.  We ordered 2 kids pizza, 2 soups and a quesadilla.  I am a dough rewards member, but I will not be returning to that location.

The food was good but the service was excellent. My mom and I came in for lunch and Rob was our server. He is outstanding! One of the best servers I have ever had at any restaurant. The five stars is for Service. I would give the food 3.5 stars.

I came to CPK back in December with my friend and have been contemplating whether or not to post my experience on Yelp. I've been to other CPK locations and love the restaurant. I have had pleasant experiences; however my experience at this particular location has deterred any future visit since. I would like to share my distasteful experience here in hopes of returning back to CPK one day. I When I walked in, I was enthusiastically greeted by the host and was directed to my seat. As usual, I was provided with a menu and asked what I wanted to drink. When it came around to order, I ordered the asparagus and spinach spaghettini. I also ordered their salted caramel pudding for dessert.  When I received my spaghetti, I found the outside peel of a garlic glove. That didn't bother me too much. I had completed my stay here with the final check and left. My stay was done here....not so fast.  A couple hours later, I started experiencing stomach pain. My stomachache lasted several hours into the night and I had trouble sleeping. Finally at 6 am, I threw up all of the asparagus and spinach spaghettini. I had gotten food poisoning from my meal here. I called the store that morning and informed the manager about my food poisoning. He apologized and told me that I would be refunded. I thanked him and hung up the phone. Few weeks went by and I didn't see a refund and kind of forgot about it.  For some reason, I still have a grudge against this restaurant. I guess I'm just disappointed that this restaurant doesn't really value their customers and doesn't take more safety precautions to keep their customers safe.  I have nothing to say about their service; their service is good. On the contrary, the food just isn't up to par. I would suggest that this restaurant, in particular, (based on reading prior feedback) work on their service and food safety. This review isn't to cause fear for future customers, it is just to inform.  Thank you.

Ordered a pizza to go for lunch. Called in the order and headed that way, was ready to go right when I got there (little under 15 minutes) hot and fresh. Got the five cheese and fresh tomato original hand tossed pizza. Pizza was alright, a lot of tomato on it so if you aren't big on tomatoes like myself you might ask for light on the fresh tomato. Really good Chipotle style ranch though.

Yay! We got complimentary chips & guacamole salsa. It was yummy! Chips were crunchy & quacamole was fresh with corn, tomato & black beans nicely put together that gives you that zesty taste salsa. We also ordered BBQ chicken pizza that's thick crust. Tasted really good all around.  Great server & greater! Thanks everyone for making our first experience eating here more memorable. For sure come back !!!

Omg I was so blown away food was super delicious our server was amazing n let us know any answers to my million questions. N still was sweet thank you Michael n the rest of the California. Staff.. will be coming back soon :-)

This location has really opened my eyes to cpk.  The crew here is top notch.  From the cooks down to the busboys.  I come here regularly and see the consistency this crew brings.   The food?  The ingredients are definitely NOT the bottom of the barrel.  I really enjoy not only the pizza but even the pasta.   X-factor?  The beer and drink selection gets over looked.  They have great beers on draft and on bottle.  The signature drinks are the same.

The food's OK. They changed the menu awhile ago, making it more difficult for allergy-sufferers to find reasonable food choices. But I went anyway, since I had a gift card. I had the same thing as last time (chicken piccata). It was fine. But this visit, the service was lousy!  I got there at 1pm and said I'd like a table for 2. They said it'd be just a few minutes, even though there were plenty of empty tables. I waited. And waited. If I'd known they wanted me to wait until the person I was meeting was there, I would've sat in the bar. I really wanted a glass of wine. But since they just left me in the waiting area, I missed out on it, and they missed out on making money from it. Then the person meeting me finally showed up and I asked again (and got) a table. We got water and just sat there for a LONG time. Then I overheard "wait, who's serving table 30?". Apparently that was us. She stepped it up when we finally saw her, but good grief.

I came to CPK with my family for an evening meal. Usually CPK is my utter favorite place but the service was terrible and the waitress was dead as well as inattentive to our table. Towards the end of my meal i had to ask for an extra side of ranch but when she brought it out there was a bug in it and she didnt even seem to care, and she just sent out another but i had lost my appetite by then.  The entire meal there were little gnats flying around inside and eventually ended up in my food. Food was decent just slow service even with an empty restaurant.

1 star is generous. This CPK has the worst service, not to the fault of the servers or bussers but clearly because of the awful management. I've been going to this CPK over the years but have seen it go downhill and will never go back again. Last time I was there for lunch with my mom, our server had 10 tables I counted, it took forever to have her attention and place our order. Our food came out dry like it was under the heat lamp for half as long as it took to come out. The manager, Steve came out to talk to us and was very invasive of our dining experience. At one point we saw him lose his temper and berate a server on the floor. Completely unprofessional. The whole experience was very negative. I will never go back to spend a dollar on crappy food and poor service. Go anywhere else is my advice.

CPK one of my favorite place in Santa Ana. Food is hot, the drinks are cold, and brought to your table. The chicken BBQ pizza is Yum  :). Ask for "Cori" you get great service and she's wonderful with kids!!!!

I really did enjoy eating at this place. The food tasted great i especially like the salad. I also loved the pizza since it was thin.The service I received was great, our waitress was very friendly. My favorite cpk so far.

Ana was great !!! The lunch atmosphere was intense, we were able to get a booth and great service with it too. We had the split pea soup with a little bit of mozzarella cheese, next was the Asian chicken salad paired with the veggie pizza with no cheese. Food was brought out quickly and with no errors. I would give them 5 stars but the bathroom was a little dirty. Wish I could give 4.5

This is my first time here in a very long time.  I was surprised to find one of my new favorite pizzas... my favorite flavors all in one! Get the Pear Gorgonzola pizza, add mushrooms. So freakin good. Imagine thin crispy crust topped with gorgonzola cheese, caramelized onions, pear, mushrooms,  hazelnuts and arugala salad. The taste is fresh, savory, yet sweet. Mmmm. I will for sure go back just for this.

I have never been to a CPK restaurant but by how the service was my boyfriend and I would definitely come back! Our waitress was named Tiffany and she was great! It was our first time going and they gave us complementary flat bread. She told me her pasta was with green noodles and I freaked out. She said if I didn't like it I could change it and it would be free. I loved it! Great experience!

I was in the area, so I stopped by for an early lunch with a girl friend of mine. I always get the Chicken Ceaser sandwich. It was just as expected. Delicious and the perfect size. We stopped by right before the lunch rush so there wasn't a wait. Thumbs up for our server too, she was nice.

We ate on the patio. The food and service were good. We like CPK a lot. This is going to sound silly but it's true-- the patio chairs were the most godawful furniture I've ever sat on in a restaurant. Plastic wicker chairs with a weird shaped angled seat that squeezes your legs together and downward. I'm not heavy (6'1, 190#) so it's not an obesity issue. The chairs are just bizarrely built and grossly uncomfortable after only a matter of minutes. By the time I got up I could hardly walk. Where did this furniture come from, some kind of patio seating torture chamber?!

I came here for dinner because Olive garden next door had us waited for 45 minutes if we were to dine there. I remember back in my early college days, CPK was considered a super fancy place to dine. College students' primary diet is usually cheap fast foods and instant noodles. Anyway, we ordered a Thai chicken pizza, Moroccan salad, and a jambalaya pasta. Thai pizza here isn't as good as some other places I've had but still decent. I like the Moroccan salad minus the red beets and the jambalaya was too salty in my opinion. I guess I only come back to CPK again during desperate time like last night but it wouldn't be my "let's-go-eat-there-place".

I have been here several times. I noticed that the customer service drops a lot when you are ordering to go. Every time I've ordered out they have forget something or didn't add simple things like utensils or bread. While dinning there, you still can a below average waitering service. Staff doesn't seem to be very happy or pleasant. I recommend finding another CPK chain to dine at.

Stopped here with some friends to wait out traffic.  We sat on the patio and shared a Thai pizza and the white corn guacamole and chips.  Both delish!  Our server was very pleasant and checked on us at appropriate intervals as we chit chatted away.  Also tried the white wine flight which was refreshing, especially the Riesling.  Nice location, attached to the mall.  Shop, drop, and eat!

Jeff and our sever were awesome. Good sized portions and love the kids menu! I do wish the would give more bread and offer butter too!  The BBQ chicken pizza and Jamaican jerk are still my favs but I have seen some good pastas I want to try!

I would rather drive to another CPK than come back to this one. Went in on a weeknight, only a few people dining. My husband and I got a table right away (hostess was nice) but after that no one come to greet us. After 20 mins the hostess comes and gets our drinks. Yayyy at least now we have a beverage but 20 mins or more pass by and NO SERVER YET!! at this point I wanted to leave (husband really love their chicken tequila) finally she comes gets our order ten mins later we get our food!!! I'm used to waiting for our food not THE SERVER! !! Won't be going back to this location. There's plenty other CPK with better service. I rather tip someone who actually earn those extra dollars. Ugh!!

Our server went above and beyond for us. I hadn't noticed my free entree coupon had expired and he took it anyway. Our drinks were made to perfection & our food was yummylicious. What more can you ask for?  This is a good place to stop and have a yummy lunch.  I did notice a waitress just hanging out in the bar area most of my time here talking to a coworker. Meanwhile other tables were waiting to be attended to.

Despite the negative reviews, decided to try this location. There was no wait time on a Friday night and our food/drinks came out at a reasonable time. Their drinks we're a tad watered down for their price.
Food was good but the service was bad. The waitress staff was not in a good mood that day and we're going though the motions.

When it comes to chair restaurant, service it what makes the difference.  You know what food you will expect and those expectation are often met consistently.  I visited this CPK as part of a fundraiser for a fallen officer.  From the minute we walked in we were greeted by the friendly hostess.  Once my server Doug took over I knew it would be a great dining experience.  Doug was energetic, friendly, and most importantly knowledgeable about the menu.  My drink was never empty which is huge for me.  The manager on duty also checked up on us and another server offered to remove plates from the table even though we weren't assigned to her.  Overall, we had a great dining experience.  If you are in the area and are contemplating CPK, this location is an excellent choice.

Doug is an awesome waiter! But seriously ask for Doug he was so nice and accommodating! And patient! Love Doug! He provided friendly service although we were in a large group with several separate checks! Doug is the crown jewel of CPK Main Place and also easy on the eyes.

Met up with my sister to have lunch here about a week ago. I was never really fond of CPK's food since I thought their pizzas were small and overpriced but my sister apparently liked this place a lot so I met her here for lunch. It was semi-busy but the service was nice - the waitress was very friendly and quick. We ordered two small plates and an entree to share. We had the White Corn Guacamole and chips and the Shaved Mushroom and Spinach Flatbread. They were both pretty tasty small plates and it's pretty filling if you order two or three of them. The entree we had shared was the Garlic Cream Fettuccine - I was surprised that it was pretty good - the white chicken pieces were juicy and the garlic cream sauce was really good and creamy.  I guess their food wasn't as bad as I had tried before - well at least the small plates and pasta. Though I still think the pizzas are overpriced and small.

I still love my CPK Pizzas... especially the Thai Chicken.   I pay the vig (an extra $1.50) and get my pizzas on thin crust.  Not only do I like the crispiness of thin crusts better, it also increases the size of the pizza by about 25%.  It turns a personal pizza into a huge personal pizza.   We've all pretty much been to CPKs so there's not too much need for me to go on and on about them.  They do try to reinvent their side dishes and experiment with new pastas and pizzas about once a year, but their core signature dishes have always remained on the menu. Thai Chicken Pizza on Thin Crust - I love the crispy crust that is smothered with peanut hoisin sauce, chicken chunks, bean sprouts,  julienned carrots and green onion slivers. It's an unbeatable mix.   Chinese Chicken Salad - Pricey for the amount you get, but I love it.  A hoisin sauce and peanut based dressing with chicken, cilantro, green onions and carrots with fried wonton skins.   The service at this location is good.  They are always quick to take my order, offer me complimentary bread, and they have yet to mess up an order.  They haven't failed me yet in 10 years, which keeps me coming back for work lunch breaks.

Great service, quality food and a nice relaxing atmosphere! What more can you ask for. This place serves up consistently good food. Don't think I've ever had a bad meal here! Their chopped salad is so flavorful and light - the half order is the perfect portion. Never had to ask for refills because our waiter was always one step ahead! Love receiving great service and I love tipping way above 20% when it's well deserved! Thanks for a tasty early dinner CPK!!

Located at the Mainplace Mall on the second floor next to the Applebee's. It's a little dark inside in my opinion, but room-y. Came during a weeknight for dinner and there was a good crowd, but not too busy. What we got: Complimentary Bread: first batch, the bread was super hard and semi-cold. Second batch, bread was much softer and warm. The oil that it came with was okay...I've had better. Red Wine Flight ($12): came with 3 oz glasses of Markham Merlot, Ravenswood 'Vintner's Blend' Zinfandel, and J. Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon. I didn't try it since I'm not a wine person...but my BF said the Ravenswood was definitely is favorite one.  Kung Pao Spaghetti w/ Chicken ($11 + $3 for chicken): so my co-worker's husband made this one day for a potluck during work so I had to try it here...my co-worker's husband makes it better! Comes with green onions, peanuts and chili peppers. Noodles could have been cooked just a little more because it was still a bit on the hard side. Kung pao taste wasn't that strong, but it had a whole bunch of peanuts. Small portion for $14 too... Hawaiian BBQ Chicken ($14): comes with 8 slices with bbq chicken, pineapple, red onions, and cilantro. Good? Yes. Better than the kung pao spaghetti. Service: Our server was excellent. BF was having a hard time deciding what to get, but our server didn't rush us and would come back every few minutes to see if we were ready to order yet. Water cups were always filled. Trash/dirty plates were taken away pretty quick. Check came and left fast. To-go boxes came out quick too.

Went here for date night with my hubby,  OMG we had the best time.  Got there was seated right away and the staff was so attentive.  Our waiter was really patient as we took out time looking at the menu.  Hubby got fish tacos and I got the BBQ chicken pizza.  Both were delicious.  We even got to be test testers for one of their new flat bread appetizer.  It was so good.  If you are looking for a great meal for a decent price come here.

Been going to CPK since the early 90s. Back then we absolutely loved the place. These days, it's just OK. It seems to be gradual and subtle decline in quality, and certainly the selection has been narrowed. We still go maybe once a month, mostly because it's something the family can agree on, but when I pay the bill I'm thinking of what else I'd rather have eaten for the money.

We come here often to get pizza and salads which are good. Recently tried the spinach and asparagus spaghettini and it was great! This review is also a long over due review to our favorite server Michael  (although name tag says Miguel) he has the best personality and gives good recommendations on food!  We always try to get seated in his section, he's the best! :)

I am giving 5 stars because the service was on point and the food was very good. We had a few hiccups but the manager took care of us and he was awesome. We came to support Orange Little League and I am happy to pay the higher price here, knowing 20% goes to OLL.

It was alright. Service wad ok. Ordered the Avocado Spring Roll appetizer which was tasty but there was only one bite worth of avocado in each roll. Kinda dissapointing. Ordered a passion fruit mojito. The first one was really sweet but I was fine with that.  I think maybe there was no lime. Then I ordered a second of the same drink.  And it tasted completely different. Too much lime and it was very tart. The waiter had it remade and the third one was less tart but not as sweet at the first one. Their mixed drinks seriously lacked consistency. I'll be back though. I like some of the other stuff on the menu but not for drinks or the appetizer.
First time at this location. Amazing customer service "Rosa" you are great. Great food

I dined tonight at cpk and I ordered a lettuce wrap with the chicken and it came out with a hair in it. I did not make a big deal about it, but I did tell my waitress "I do have a comment, there's a hair in my food" she replied with "oh i don't think that's a hair, I think that's something else but I'll make you a new one". (Never make the customer feel they are incorrect or wrong, it was definitely a hair.) I understand hairs get into food even with hair nets. I use to work in foods) If it's not a hair, why make a new one? I was later introduced by the floor manager who was very nice, I liked his attitude and friendliness.  What made me upset is that when my bill came, I didn't expect any kind of compensation for that hair in my lettuce wrap appetizer nor did I ask for one, BUT my waitress said "Due to the inconvenience we have comp'd your lettuce wrap dish and also gave you a 20% discount. We always want the customer happy." I said oh thank you! Thats so nice of you. Turns out, they ring in two lettuce wraps 20 dollars total and comp one which is the one that had the hair in it. So I told her, you didn't  comp the dish you charged me for two and comp'd the one that was messed up on and gave me 20% off which is 5 bucks (when lettuce wrap is $10)  she said she would have it corrected and she came back and discounted the lettuce wrap but removed the 20%. I never asked for any discount to begin with, the fact that I was not happy is because she emphasized she is comping the appetizer AND giving us 20% (going above and beyond I thought) and turns out she only kept her word on one. It's not even about the money, it's the principal. Needless to say, I will not be coming back.

I hadn't been to a California Pizza Kitchen in such a long time. We were at the Mainplace (Westfield Mall) recently and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat before meeting our friends at the movie theater.  We were really hungry and decided to split a couple of items. We were surprised by how delicious our meals were here.  We ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza and a BBQ Chicken Salad. Both were so good! I must admit that this salad was one of the best BBQ Chicken Salads I'd had in a while. The service was great here too. We were seated right away. Our drinks were brought out quickly and refilled often. Our food was served hot. The employees were all friendly and helpful here too.  I'm not sure if we'll be going back to CPK anytime soon, but if if I'm at the Mainplace Mall, I'll make sure to get that delicious salad or order that yummy pizza to-go!

Thank you Natalie (our server) she suggested all the best, delicious and super filling meal! She was so patient and helpful with all our question.  It was awesome,  and she was super sweet!  We will be back when Natalie is here!
My husband and I,  love the food here and the service was awesome!! Veronica, and Michael were very attentive and fast with anything we needed. I totally recommend you eat here.

: ( this place isn't worth the time. Sat outside - waited 20 minutes for h2o. Another 20+ passed before a warm, sad little martini appeared. Another 20 minutes, still no food, no bread and no waiter. We took off. 60 minutes of life wasted...  Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice...bad yelp review. Sorry cpk. You're going down into the "never again" book for good.

Just came in for lunch because we were at the mall. Edgar was great-- that's MAYBE the only reason we would be back.  His service was definitely 5 stars--pleasant, observant and helpful/knowledgable.  We showed up at noon with two other tables occupied, so they weren't busy by any means. The rest of the staff was not pleasant as they were standing around since it wasn't busy. We ordered a pizza and it came out with two slice practically missing cheese and toppings (picture uploaded) for a $15 pizza it was surely disappointing. The bread is a nice touch but there were little gnats that kept landing on it so made it really unappetizing.
Always a favorite.  Salads here are really good and obviously the pizza is great.  Thai chicken pizza is my favorite.

My friend and I we're dining here sitting  near the bar. The bar tender makes good looking drinks, but whats unattractive is when the waitresses including the manager take a sip out of the drinks that are about to be served to clients. The bartender should have stopped them! It's sad they sip out of the straw the drink has and they'll be taking to the table that ordered; they also take new straws and keep trying the drinks each single one before delivering. The drinks were served to a table outside. (You never know how clean a mouth can be)  also witnessed the manager putting cilantro over the pizzas with unwashed hands! I'll never come here again. This place needs better management. They do what they want.

everyone was SO nice when I went in' they are in the middle of a remodel, but it's not too bad! also, they have a new lunch menu where you can get a pizza and a salad for $10.95! I had a veggie pizza with a Greek salad and it was delicious! will definitely be coming back for the friendly customer service and delicious food. if you go, ask for Doug!

S..l..o..w..e..s..t... service EVER.  If you are going to re-decorate then do it ALL not partly so that the rest of the restaurant looks like crap.  Really slow service...didn't refill water until done with dinner.  Check with credit card has been gone for 5 minutes. Waiting for orders was slow too.   Understaffed!

Agree with recent postings...this whole "rustic" re-decorating has created a bland-looking restaurant that is loud, sterile, and void of the charm that once made CPK "something different". I feel like everyone around me is literally on top of me and the place looks half-decorated. Loud music too and the manager was meandering about with a un-tucked plaid shirt looking like a early 20 yr old who just rolled-out of bed at some remote cabin. The service was bad too. I don't get it CPK.....you've lost the charm that made it special and it seems to have sapped the energy out of the place. Oh, and did I mention that the prices went up yet again on almost every item. A freaking personal pizza is easily $15 now (regular crust) and they're at a point now where it's time to consider other options. Good job CPK in a down-economy and thanks Obama.

Service sucked, slow, order wrong. Appetizers out after the main. No refills on drinks, even after requested. But, the food was good so I'm sure we will be back, maybe to a different location.  SPD kid- too loud for my SPD kid and she complained of the smells. They have a patio so that would have solved it.

I haven't been to a California Pizza Kitchen in a while... Just came to the one across from my office, it has been newly decorated, which is nice. The music is so obnoxiously loud, we had to sit outside, where it is not as loud. The music belongs in a nightclub. Not going to come back!

Nice spot, very clean and nice staff. Food came in pretty quick. We had a party of 13 and we had a good time with the very fresh food! I got jambalaya and it was so good. Very flavorful and had a bit of a spicy kick to it.

Meeting a few a my kids for dinner so my son came up with CPK. of course we've been to this and other locations many times over the years, just wanted to mention this particular visit.  The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. They did recently remodel this local, now it has a bistro/cafe feel! Food good as always as is the overall value! Of course for me seeing a few a my grown children was the biggest kick of the night!!!

OMG I love this place the food is awesome way better then those other pizza places ahah ! I loved my server Cindy she is so spunky quirky and energetic ahah she is my fav person to be helped by she is always there asking if you need something a refill or asks if everything is fine she is on top of her gAme if you get a chance to stop by make sure to ask for her !!!!! I love the egg rolls they are amazing  so far best cpk I been to

Went there for lunch today with my family. They sat us pretty quickly but things went down hill from there. It took quite awhile for us to get our drinks then the bread seemed to take some time to arrive (we had to ask twice). I ordered a salad with my meal with ranch and when I got the salad it was like they just waved the dressing over the plate. I asked for some extra dressing and it took FOREVER for them to bring me the dressing (another server had to finally get that for me). When we finally got our main course (that once again took a long time) it was kind of dumped on the table and the server left without asking if we needed anything else. My wife ordered the chicken piccata with pasta and unfortunately her meal came with something extra, a long black hair wrapped in spaghetti noodle (my wife has blonde hair). They did ask if she wanted another meal or dessert but by that time her stomach had turned and we asked for the bill. Anyway, $86.00 later for a way too long of a wait for lunch that came with someone else's DNA and you can be sure that I will not be coming back to this place.
Good great Service good  Noise level ridiculous was told knob broken and the volume was as low as it could go!

Had a great lunch with my gf here today.  They were sooooo accommodating with her having a gigantic stroller with and infant and a 2 year old in them.  They let us sit in the corner where we had asked and made sure we were taken care of the whole time.   I was also difficult as far as what I wanted to order.  I made a lot of substitutions and she was very informative as well as not annoyed about it. I would say by far the best cpk location I've been to yet!

Oddly enough, the first time I ever went to CPK was when I lived in Atlanta, Georgia. That means I have loved their BBQ chicken chopped salad for 15 years or more. Since we're visiting family in Cali, I was excited that they chose to meet at CPK because I hadn't been to one since those days in the A-T-L.  We arrived around 4:15 and it took them a few minutes to set up the tables for nine of us. Over the next hour or so the restaurant filled up, but at the time we ordered, the place was about 1/3 full. Bread with olive oil and the appetizers we ordered came out quickly, but there was a long wait between appetizers and our entrees.  Our waitress was thrown off her game a little when she accidentally spilled a large soda and it splattered all over the table and some of us. It took a while to clean up and after that she seemed a bit sheepish, although she was very attentive to our drink refill requests.  I would recommend CPK of you have 1. a lot of time and 2. a large family or kids. Overall the process of getting your food takes a while. And it's so loud in there that it doesn't matter if your kids are being loud, it just adds to the noise. It was perfect for us because there were two little ones and two teens in our party. But I remember seeing dismayed looks on couples' faces - maybe at not having received their food or because they couldn't hold a conversation with each other.  Overall it was great to spend time with family, but the speed and execution of the service could stand improvement. The reason I'm giving three stars instead of two: the BBQ Chicken Salad is just as delicious as it was all those years ago.

First of all, I hate to give a one star. I ordered take out in person and didn't realize the girl never input one of the items I had wanted, whatever, I ordered more than enough food for a lunch so didn't bother me at the time. Waited a while and finally got my food. I ordered the Tuscan hummus with no tomato. Guess what I found when I got home, tomato! I also ordered the asparagas and spinach pasta, so disappointing as it was too salty. I fed it to my husband who usually likes his food well seasoned and he said it was unbearably salty!  If I had dined in that definitely would have been sent back to the kitchen. What a sucky experience.
