Ambience: A Cleanliness: A Customer Service: A++++++ Food: A Overall Rating: A+ Price  -Its a little price for a pizza place, but the portion sizes are huge. I wouldn't go here every day of the week but for a special occasion it's not bad.  Atmosphere -It has a sort of fancy/casual feel to it...it's certainly not fine dining, but it doesn't feel like you're at a fast food joint either.  Customer Service  -I can't say enough good things about our waitress! We had come here after a long day in Disneyland (and having a bad breakfast experience at another restaurant) and our waitress was just amazing!! She was funny, spunky and had a great laugh that just made all our stress melt away.  Food  -The Waldorf salad was on point! The BBQ pizza was also delicious and the two other people at my table said their food was amazing as well.  Overall  -I love this place! Certainly will have to stop back next time I'm in Cali.

This location was just fully renovated not too long ago. I attended a yelp elite event in Irvine and was able to try almost everything on the menu. I'm not here to write a review about their pizza even though this is a pizza place. Surprisingly the best thing on their menu is the ribeye steak. It's USDA Prime beef and cooked medium rare to perfection. I never thought I would get a steakhouse quality cut at my local pizza place. Make sure to change it up and give a steak a try next time you hit up CPK.

I don't think I'd go back. I went here while it wasn't that busy but it still took a long time to order and get the bill. I specifically ask for goat cheese, when I got my pizza, there was no goat cheese on it! When I mentioned it to the waitress she said"I'm sorry,  I wrote no goat cheese" (goat cheese is an option you request for a dollar and a half more! !!) Later manager comes by and brings a little plate with goat cheese and says"at least you are getting your goat cheese now" !!!

It is a CPK.  Not sure what else needs to be said.  The staff is friendly, and the menu is corporate.  They are now known for popularizing Wolfgang Puck's (and others') concept of "California Pizzas," non-traditional toppings and sauses on a traditional pizza base.  The food is good and consistent, and they have decent pastas and salads as well.  Like Cheesecake Factory, if someone in your group can't find something they like on the menu, then you don't need that type of person in your life.  But if this is their favorite restaurant (or Cheesecake Factory is), you probably don't need them in your life either.
Bombdotcom.... I love their lettuce wraps... their catering is amazing and the staff is awesome. I love coming to CPK to have lunch with my son, husband, friends, inlaws.... anyone...

I just want to share a story 2 years ago I went to this place it was St. Patricks day and ordered green beer the server said they don't serve green beer but she will ask the bartender. The guy was so nice he made one for me! Very good service and good food!

Been here 3 times. Customer service is quick and friendly. They're constantly checking on you to make sure everything meets your standards! It's not to the point of suffocating you either. Servers are always around if you have a question and they make sure your entrees arrive in a timely manner - something everyone I've been here with appreciates.  Recently it was a Thursday night and the host reassured my group that our server will come momentarily. I think his name was Bob. He was very friendly and welcoming to us! Informative and helpful with our orders. When the check came, we asked for it to be split by entrees, which he happily fulfilled for us! Go Bob! The food is always spot on delicious. No complaints. Perhaps if you're hungry for pasta, you should go to another place since my friend wanted more servings of it after his plate.  Clean, professional, timely in food delivery.... And is it a thing that they hold the doors open for you when you enter and exit? Because that's pretty neat!

CPK is usually a 5 star experience for me but tonight was lackluster. I brought my brother and two younger cousins to try it out. We're Asian so while we're actually all in our early 20s, we look probably like mid-teens. I feel like our appearances factored into our treatment. We were seated by a lovely older group and there was another older couple across from us. The couple beside us was helped at least twice as often as us, and the waitress would glance at us and then skip over us to the other table across to ask about how they were doing. I had to flag them down to get refills on drinks, bread, and spoons because our plates of food didn't come with spoons like usual. Kat was our waitress and while we had to flag her down to get things, she had an amicable personality.  The fettuccine was a little bland this time, and I usually love it. They were generous with the shrimp though! The pesto penne on the other hand had only a bare sprinkling of tomatoes (my favorite part). It's kind of hit and miss with how much tomatoes are given in the penne dishes as far as my experience goes.  The bolognese and asparagus spaghettini were delicious except my cousin said that the chicken was salty. It surprised me that she had a complaint because she's really easy to please with food lol. The receipt given didn't outline the breakdown of costs as well which was weird. Overall, it was an average experience. The food was simply okay, despite spending $100+ for the entirety. With that much, I would expect a better experience like CPK usually offers me. The service was lackluster as well, and there wasn't the excuse of a busy night, which I always take into consideration when rating service. I'm a little sad that it wasn't better because my cousins now have an average opinion of CPK when I know it can and has been better.

Where is the manager? Can you please train your staff? I made the pizza & salad to go, but decided to eat at the restaurant instead. I was served with a plastic spoon and plastic cup. The desserts were ordered later while we're dining in the restaurant and she still served us with plastic cup.
Do not expect your food to be on time for takeout.  My order was placed for an 11 am pick up.  It's 11:31 and I am still waiting. Completely unacceptable and I will not order again
CPK is one of my favorites great Ambiance great service great food chicken barbecue chicken is my favorite try them all

Well, thought I'd give this place one last try. What a huge mistake, this used to be our favorite family day spot. Then all the sudden service went to crap, the only positive is "STEVEN" our step in server. Cause our assigned server Mauricio made maybe one appearance. I was asked by many different employees did I need anything, Um isn't our assigned server supposed to do that? Food was sub par which was a huge disappointment, considering we are regulars here. Unfortunately this will be our last visit to our location and the only reason I gave one star was solely based on "STEVEN'S" hustle. Hopefully they get it together! HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!
They need new, different forks. No matter how you dig into your salad, you only end up with a tiny bite of food. So frustrating and taking forever to eat.

Tori is my girl! My family and I had dinner tonight at CPK for my dad's birthday although we were somewhat unsure about the quality of our food due to previous experiences. We were a party of 5, but waiting on 1 for about 15 minutes. Tori was super friendly and extremely patient with us when it came to waiting for our plus 1 and ordering our food. Tori said she was extremely busy and apologized in advanced if service was going to be a bit slow but girl was on top of it! She brought us bread and refills more than three times! And that was without flagging her down, which we were worried about since we were stuck in a lonely corner. Our food was hot and she made sure we were more than happy with what we had ordered. My family and I were super relieved and extremely satisfied with this recent trip and I hope you all request Tori as a server as she is super nice, attentive and HILARIOUS. Thumbs up management you are doing something right!
Hostess was friendly and made us feel welcomed right away. The free bread is delicious and difficult to turn down. Highly recommend the BBQ chicken pizza and harvest kale salad.

Stopped in for dinner last night and was thrilled with our service. The host was very friendly and we were able to be seated immediately. Our waitress Torie was seriously amazing though!! She was so friendly, and gave us great service.

We ordered our dinner to go with curbside pick up but when we got home one of our meals was incomplete.  The grilled veggie salad I ordered was missing the grilled veggies!  I immediately called and spoke to the manager who went above and beyond to make it up to me.  Thank you so very much!  The rest of our food was awesome and the Butter Cake was delicious.  This amazing customer service will make loyal customers out of us!

I got the worst food poisoning from the chicken lime fettuccine two days ago. I just got home from the hospital from dehydration which almost put me into labor. I will never be back. My two year old also got sick from it. It was so hard to care for her and to be in the hospital.

The host promptly greeted us and we were sat quickly. Our server, Amber provided great service and got our drink orders after we sat down. When asked about a dish, she gave a good description and she was friendly and attentive throughout our evening. We sat in the patio tonight and it was pleasant out there. The warm bread and olive oil was good. The half Warm Grilled Vegetable Salad was plenty to share and was really good with green beans and big chunks of avocado over mixed greens and a light dressing. It was a nice salad for night time to accompany our Thin Crust Sicilian Pizza and Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. Both the pizza and pasta didn't seem very heavy. There was a lot of meat on the pizza and it was nice and hot. The thin crust was just a tad crunchy and held the toppings well. There were bits of chicken and julienned onions and peppers in the pasta and not too much sauce. I enjoyed the light cream sauce and onions mixed in with the Fettuccine. The temperature of the pasta was luke warm though.
Horrible service. We waited for over 45 mins for our food.  The manager comes out to appologize but still made us wait for another 30 mins for fricken salads!!!

Came in with my husband and his little brother -- both have not been to CPK before.  Service: Before reaching the door Jodi was already holding it open and welcoming us with a huge smile. She showed us to our table and was super enthusiastic. Her service was fantastic. Our server Alina was just as sweet. I had checked in on Yelp and our server had even waited for me to register so that I could have a small plate for the table.  Food: The free small plate we tried was the Mac and cheese balls. At other places I always thought the Mac and cheese balls were soggy. Here they were cooked perfectly and the macaroni inside was al dente! Perfect! I convinced my hubs to try the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza and as always it was impressive. My brother in law had himself about three refills on mango lemonade so I'm guessing it was good. All in all a five star Yelp experience. Thanks CPK!

I've been here many many times and have them catered food for my company many times and it has always been a nice pressure. But aside from the food looking different today, the service was just ridiculous. Everyone is extremely nice and our waitress Cindy is sweet and was great. But the hostess Natalie she was just rude and extremely unfriendly. Everyone that came in she barely said hi to them but when her own friends came she was a different person. Restaurant manager you should do something about.
Another lunch time favorite at the mall. Staff is super friendly and attentive and the food never disappoints!

DO NOT EAT HERE! I came in during lunch and got a chicken sandwich with a Cesar salad and I regret it so much. I noticed the chicken was really hard in the middle, so much so that I couldn't even bite into it. I didn't even finish my sandwich and left in a rush back to work. I started feeling EXTREMELY sick shortly after. I was throwing up for almost 6 hours on and off, I ended up having to go to the ER because I couldn't even keep down water and blacked out from throwing up so much. The doctor said it was definitely food poisoning.. probably from cross contamination or poorly cooked meat. I'm still recovering a week later and barely have an appetite. If you don't want to end up getting sick, go to the other restaurants in the mall. AVOID THIS CPK AT ALL COSTS. I will NEVER EVER go back.

I do think CPK has stepped up their game a bit. Plenty of menu options besides just pizza, healthy offerings as well. I enjoy their soups and salads and even the salmon here was pretty good. Service was fine, food came out quickly. Portions are descent, but it is a bit pricey for chain restaurant food. Clean restaurant with plenty of seating, descent food but not worth going out of my way to return.

Okay, so I love this place. But today I did a takeout order and they didn't give me salad dressing or anything extra I ordered. They made my pizza wrong, added chicken to everything when I clearly said not to. Apparently the call center were the people to blame, whatever. When I called to talk to the manager he absolutely did not care and hung up on me. Hope next time is better

The food was good. Tasted just like all the other cpk chains. My favorites are the shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread and tequila chicken fettuccine. Service is definitely lacking. Multiple visits now, the host is rarely at the front. Usually have to stand awkwardly and wait. Or if there is a host, I'm still being ignored and not greeted for whatever reasons. The servers here are not attentive at all. My server tonight was alright but could work on her friendliness level. I mean would a smile kill ya? The wait for the food does take a while here. Whether it's a full house or empty, you still wait a good while for your food. I just go to this location because it's convenient for me.

I tried Door Dash for the 2nd time with my cpk order from this restaurant @ main place mall.. (1st time with Door Dash great, but they already heard from me regarding this order.) I ordered the Cobb salad, no Gorgonzola cheese, tossed with ranch dressing. There was an option to add beets for an additional cost, but I did not select it. My Cobb salad arrived un-tossed (?) WITH beets! After I get over myself, I get up to go get a bowl figuring I can toss it myself and remove the beets. I go to open the dressing and immediately smell that it's bleu cheese---that's an automatic "nope!"  While I believe DoorDash is partly responsible for the lack of quality control, CPK actually prepared my food based on my selections--what if I were allergic to beets?? .. thank goodness a BBQ pizza was also ordered---already snagged a slice..

This CPK has great servers and food. The problem is that I have been there 2 times recently on Sunday night and they seem to be understaffed. A lot of open tables,  but we still have to wait up to 30 minutes for a table. The bathrooms are gross. They really need to clean the bathrooms, and they were completely out of hand towels in the ladies room.
The food is good, but the portions are small.., when you order pasta or chicken with salad there's only a few strips of chicken.

This is the nearest CPK to our home.  While we were eating my kids put tons of Parmesan cheese on there  pizza and pasta. When one of the kids lifted the Parmesan cheese bottle I noticed tons of  Green moldy chunks  in the bottom of Parmesan shaker . We were all disgusted and not feeling well at all . As some of the cheese  on top was also green .  We spoke to manager and he apologized resulting them to start using fresh Parmesan in a grinder  He promised to take care of us next visit n return I didn't share this experience on yelp . We agreed and now takes us to our recent visit .  We told the new manager named  Salso was his name or i think Salsa was his name  What we were told to let them know , what happened and they were gonna help us with better experience . He was very rude and not helpful and just acting like a little bitch.  So I had to share this experience , if u notice now they don't use the Parmesan shaker it's cause of our experience with green moldy Parmesan from the CPK main place location in Santa Ana .

I don't know if I expected more or if it was really bad. My wife's steamed veggies were very soggy. My steak looked nothing like the picture on the menu, which I understand, but my steak looked like it was in a plate of soup, not over veggies.  The restaurant looked beautiful and I was hoping for the same in the food.  The salmon was very dry and fishy. The jalapeño Bloody Mary did not have jalapeños or salt.  It was just a bad experience. We will. It be going back anytime soon.
Ordered ahead, got there and still waited over 10 minutes to get a BBQ salad. Nonsense!

I would have liked to talk to the manager instead of writing a long Yelp review, but because it already took so long for my co-workers and I to get our check and get back to work, I didn't feel like wasting anymore time at this place. My group of co-workers thought it would be a good and quick place to get lunch today. Man, were we wrong. Two of my co-workers in our group got their orders messed up. One asked for no blue cheese on their salad, and they got blue cheese. The other co-worker asked for avocado in her salad, and didn't have any avocado. Since we couldn't find our waiter, we tried to get an employee's attention. Once we told her the situation, she didn't apologize that the orders were wrong. She just said I'll take care of it. And thankfully she did correct the situation. But the server never came back and never apologized for the error. That annoyed me because he should have at least apologized for getting both of the orders wrong and that did not happen. Not only that, when we got the check, the waiter messed up on the check too. My one co-worker that got blue cheese on her salad got charged twice: once for the first salad that was wrong and the second one for the new salad. First of all, that is not right. Both salads that were wrong for both my co-workers should have been comped. But they weren't. That made me even more annoyed than before. And once I realized the error in the check, it took 15 mins. for us to find our server again and have him correct it. And then it took forever for him to come back to actually pick up the check and bring it back. We waited for so long that I was just getting more upset. I work for an institution that holds customer service in the highest regard and it is our top priority. I can tell you right now that this place does not care one iota about the service they give. You can tell that the employees there don't care and it shows. At the end of it, our whole group all felt like we had received just terrible service. CPK, you just lost 5 customers.

I've been going to CPK since I was a child--the CPKs in Rolling Hills and Southbay Galleria. However, this was my first time at this location and it did not disappoint. I came here during my school break to meet with a couple of friends. The waitress serving us was very friendly and accommodating and did not rush us. I wasn't too hungry and only ordered 2 appetizer dishes, fried mac and cheese and buffalo cauliflower. We were served bread and given our drinks as we waited for our orders. Our waitress always refilled out water cups and I could find no issue with the service given that day. I had to take off 1 star though because I thought the Mac and cheese would be an actual Mac and cheese and not these tiny Mac and cheese bites. However, I was happy with both of my orders and had a great time seeing old friends. The ambience was nice, there was plenty of parking and seating, and there was no wait.

If I could give a lower score I would. Ordered WILD MUSHROOM STROZZAPRETI off the to go menu. I've had it at another location and it was very good. This was very bad. The chicken breast addition was dry and burnt. The mushrooms had a burn taste and basically the whole dish was overwhelmed with the taste of burnt food that was cooked way to hot and fast.  To say that this meal sucked is an understatement. It is more like a plate full of sorrow, sadness, and lost hope. Because the parking situation at the mall sucks, I can't go back without it being a huge ordeal.  I like CPK, but this location is about the worst place I've ever eaten.

I really enjoy their outdoor patio area. If I could make one recommendation, it would be to not dine here if you are in a hurry. The waitstaff seem to take extra time and do not check on the customers on the patio as often as they should.

Family favorite!!! I had the summer salad with watermelon and strawberries. Was so delicious and refreshing!!! To bad the salad is only seasonal! Service was excellent! Restaurant was clean. Staff was very friendly.

FYI - they are at the PATIO DINING LEVEL, kinda closer to Macy's.  __________________ Well - their follow up customer service deserves 4 stars,  I am happy they made effort to resolve. __________________ Dining time was in the late PM (off hours) so they were not all that busy. The only good things were... - The taste of the water - The starter bread & oil - The add on grilled shrimp for the salad (cooked to perfection) They have this high wall, with a low opening below eye level, that the hostess has to peek thru to figure out where to seat you.  - It feels awkward - Feels bad she has to crouch down  - Perhaps they should get rid of that thing and just put in a nice plant or something with ease at eye level; or a system where you can easily figure out which tables are avail Their Hawaiian Pizza is soggy (slightly warmed up, cools fast) flat dough, only the crust is chewy and cooked thru. There is a slight stain of tomato and then thin slices of ham and pineapple.  - where's the pizza sauce and cheese? Their Waldorf Walnut, Chicken, Cheese, Grapes, Green apple pizza was a salty disaster. Lettuce leaves were wilted (going bad, had to pick them out).  There was barely any chicken, thank God I paid $5 extra for some shrimp. I tried to salvage it by asking for cut tomatoes and red onions. Didn't help. Still so salty. - Too hungry, so I just ate it - This was one of those times, where you go home to eat something more satisfying FYI - they don't carry a simple thing like Tabasco, only Cholula sauce. Service was mediocre. You ask for things. The waiter forgets. When you remind him, the food has gone cold. - Oh well, C'est la vie
The staff here are so friendly, fast and efficient. I love coming in here because it's such a warm and loving atmosphere. Thank you all for such great service. You really set the bar high.

California Pizza Kitchen is conveniently located in the Main Place mall but has an outside entrance with plenty of parking options. Pros: - Like most CPKs you receive complimentary bread & garlic/basil oil for dipping. - The food is pretty consistent and delicious, especially the pizza options and my favorite pasta to get from this location is the Chicken Tequila Pasta. - CPK has lunch specials from 11am-4pm Monday through Friday where you can have a half sandwich or small order of their pizza paired with a soup or salad and you can add chicken to your salad as well. Cons: - In the beginning we may have been sat down quick but it did take about 15 minutes to have the opportunity to order drinks, but after that the service was phenomenal! - The menus are grimy, damp, and had leftover sauce in them (view pic). - The bathrooms were not the cleanest. Overall, it's a mall located restaurant so it receives plenty of traffic but I'd hope they could give their patrons some cleaner menus. The food is delicious and came out quick for a lunch rush and the service we received after ordering our drinks was great. I'd definitely come back to see if my experience is a tad bit better, but overall not a bad place to enjoy lunch before or after your shopping spree in the mall.
Their follow-up customer service is terrible. Over one month since they asked for my contact information and no word. Guess I won't be going back to that location.

This is my favorite CPK to go to! I have been a fan for years. Celso and his team are always on point with the service. The food is always fresh, and everyone is always friendly and helpful. Every time I go to a restaurant customer service is always the number one, and he always makes every visit pleasant! Thank you so much for the great service! Me and my staff enjoy coming here for lunch and special occasions.  - Joanne

I ordered online since I wanted to spend the night in with my girlfriend. Two pizzas ordered, I got the BBQ chicken, and sausage and mushroom. Both were good don't get me wrong, but the ETA was about 20 minutes off. It stated 7:12 they would be ready, got there at 7:15 and was not leaving until 7:40ish. The girl on the inside was very nice, friendly. Just give them some buffer time for the takeout orders so you are not waiting in the store for so long.

Came here for dinner the other week and received poor service. The drinks took a long time to come out, the appetizers were ok,  I ordered the halibut and it as dry and my girlfriends dish was cold. This was on a Tuesday it wasn't even busy. Care a little but..your Fashion island location is 10x better.

ORIGINAL REVIEW Oh perfect... we're not coming... back. This literally took us an hour and a half to get our SIMPLE MEAL. So disappointed in the food as well. The mac and cheese was disgusting and it was so expensive. Waiter was nice but would not recommend UPDATE Amazing customer service honestly! They quickly asked for my contact information, gave me a call and send me a gift card so I could return for a better experience. As someone who works in the food industry, I can sympathize with an occasional flub. Bravo.

There's no telling when you're going to get youre food, or your order taken. The table that sat next to me got sat down after me and they got the order taken and food way before mine. Food is great as always. But our first time getting service like this at a cpk. Management and waiters made up for it after the restaurant slowed down a bit on that rainy Sunday afternoon.

Another great time at California Pizza Kitchen.  Wife and I are picket but we really feel this chain is spot on all the time.  We were at the mall and saw CPK; we have enjoyed the Anaheim location a number of times so we tried.  They did not disappoint.  The only negative lots of kids running g around. One family. Ugh.  They gave us complimentary flatbread because our first time at that location. Who does that?  Next time your out and about you cant go wrong with CPK.  Photo of great pizza. Oh, Shisito peppers always amazing. Don't go to chains often but will make exception with CPK!!

This is the only CPK I go to! Our friendly waiter, Steven made sure to bring everything on time. The chicken Milanese is great. The manager, Celso, is very kind, he greeted us and made sure we were satisfied with our food. We will definitely be back here!
The service started out kinda slow but they made up for it by being very attentive while eating. Was able to order my pizza how I wanted so was happy about that.
I Like this CPK it's not too crowded. Would like them to turn the music down, and not seat all families w/ kids all in the same section.

I always use to go to the one at the garden walk but today decided to try a new location and this place didn't dissapoint. We got served fresh warm bread. I love the healthy options u can order... there lunch comobow are reasonably priced and oh so yummy (they don't skimp out). Service is amazing and they are very attentive..never had an empty glass! Parking can be a challenge but that's not there fault.. use the parking structure in the back of the mall (that one has plenty of spots and then walk thru the mall to burn off those calories if you decide to get dessert.

Delicious food and cute set up. Came here for our end of soccer pizza party and got to have the kids take a tour of the kitchen and make their own pizzas! Too cute! The kids had a blast and were so happy to eat their own creations. Nice spot to grab a bite or drink while shopping inside the mall. There's a common area between stores outside where they have a tree and large Jenga game to play or play some cornhole. The mall is decorated for the holidays right now so there is a nice photo op by a tall Christmas tree.

Placed a take out order here today. This place used to be good, but now it's turning into your standard, Olive Garden style, reheated junk food. I ordered the chicken Milanese for $20. It was over cooked, rubbery and tasteless. They provided about 6 white bread rolls to go with this overpriced, undersized monstrosity. I could have gone to a nice family owned restaurant and consumed a higher quality meal for a better price. Avoid this place...

Great food and very good service, what can I say about CPK. I ordered the Jamaican Jerk pizza and my wife got a salad. We also got the free bread that is really yummy I only wish they gave us more. This location is located in side the Main Place Mall and serves a really quick lunch for those that work in the area.

I am a long time CPK fan. From a lifetime in jersey to now here in California. Although it's a chain, I would say each location ranges highly in atmosphere, service, and even food.  I like this location at The Main Place Mall. You don't have to be at the mall or even go inside to eat at the CPK. Its easily accessible from the front entrance up the big ramp. It has its own entrance so you don't have to pass through the mall at all. I'm not sure why I am going on and on about this except that trying to find a restaurant in a mall can be intimidating if traveling with young children or annoying if you are in a rush. Anyhoo, this location is spacious and has a bright atmosphere. Its not as cool and modern as the location at Anaheim Garden Walk but the parking is a bit easier and the food is infinitely better. I also prefer it over the one at Brea Mall which has way tighter seating and has a dark atmosphere as well as a long wait most of the time. I've been to the one at Main Place at least twenty times and waited maybe once.  Out of those 20-30 times I have never received poor service. They are always friendly and pretty quick with the food. If it gets busy you might have to flag someone down but thats not a big deal for me.  Pizzas are all pretty good. Its really personal preference. I am a thin crust kind of gal and love their roasted artichoke and spinach. Their tostado pizza is also yummy. The flame roasted salsa they give with it is yuuuummy.  I love a bunch of their pastas. Bolognese obviously a safe bet. Pesto cream penne tastes really good with shrimp or chicken but is heavy. Garlic cream fettuccini also yummy but heavy. If you are looking for lighter they have a relatively new pasta called Wild mushroom strozzapreti but i ordered it twice and the first time i loved it but second time was blah. The lightest pasta is the shrimp scampi zucchini but its light because they give like four fettuccine noodles so I feel cheated.  My favorite appetizer is the spinach artichoke dip but they are all pretty good. They have super huge fresh salads you can share. They got rid of my favorite spinach salad so second for me is the California Cobb but I am not a salad expert. I have yet to try a main plate or power bowl. I never ordered a small bite at this location so not sure if they have them?? but those are awesome to add. CPK used to have this spicy chicken quesadilla on their small bites menu which came with a sauce on the side - the dish was to die for but they discontinued it. Bring it baaaack! I'd say this is one of the better CPK locations in the area so give it a try.
Every time I come in here the service is awesome! Let me tell you the food tops its off! Thank you. I appreciate it.

Amazing amazing Cesar salad dressing.   I am very selective on my dressing.  It has the perfect tangy flavor.  I have not been here in years because I like to try new spots.  This is still my favorite now and I have tried slit of them.  The pizza was also amazing. The crust with thin and cheese is quality.   Good place to eat
